-- Prepared Statements tests;

--create topic testtopic;
create source test_source_1(
    col0 bigint,
    col1 tinyint,
    col2 int,
    col3 double,
    col4 decimal(10, 2),
    col5 varchar,
    primary key (col0)
) with (
    brokername = "testbroker",
    topicname = "testtopic",
    headerencoding = "json",
    keyencoding = "json",
    valueencoding = "json",
    columnselectors = (
        "k.k0"
        "v.v1"
        "v.v2"
        "v.v3"
        "v.v4"
        "v.v5"
    )
    properties = (
        "prop1" = "val1"
        "prop2" = "val2"
    )
);
Ok

--load data dataset_1;

-- ps with no params;
prepare select * from test_source_1 where col0 > 5 order by col0;
0
execute 0;
|6|600|6000|6234.432100|62345678.99|str6|
|7|700|7000|7234.432100|72345678.99|str7|
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
5 rows returned

-- now test each col type;

prepare select * from test_source_1 where col0 > ? order by col0;
1
execute 1 6;
|7|700|7000|7234.432100|72345678.99|str7|
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
4 rows returned

prepare select * from test_source_1 where col1 > ? order by col0;
2
execute 2 300;
|4|400|4000|4234.432100|42345678.99|str4|
|5|500|5000|5234.432100|52345678.99|str5|
|6|600|6000|6234.432100|62345678.99|str6|
|7|700|7000|7234.432100|72345678.99|str7|
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
7 rows returned

prepare select * from test_source_1 where col2 > ? order by col0;
3
execute 3 7000;
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
3 rows returned

prepare select * from test_source_1 where col3 > ? order by col0;
4
execute 4 6123.65;
|6|600|6000|6234.432100|62345678.99|str6|
|7|700|7000|7234.432100|72345678.99|str7|
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
5 rows returned

prepare select * from test_source_1 where col4 > ? order by col0;
5
execute 5 25000000.88;
|3|300|3000|3234.432100|32345678.99|str3|
|4|400|4000|4234.432100|42345678.99|str4|
|5|500|5000|5234.432100|52345678.99|str5|
|6|600|6000|6234.432100|62345678.99|str6|
|7|700|7000|7234.432100|72345678.99|str7|
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
8 rows returned

prepare select * from test_source_1 where col5 > ? order by col0;
6
execute 6 str5;
|6|600|6000|6234.432100|62345678.99|str6|
|7|700|7000|7234.432100|72345678.99|str7|
|8|800|8000|8234.432100|82345678.99|str8|
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
4 rows returned

-- ps with two params;
prepare select * from test_source_1 where col0 > ? and col1 > ? order by col0;
7
execute 7 6 800;
|9|900|9000|9234.432100|92345678.99|str9|
|10|1000|10000|10234.432100|93345678.99|str10|
2 rows returned

-- ps with params for all cols;
prepare select * from test_source_1 where col0 = ? and col1 = ? and col2 = ? and col3 = ? and col4 = ? and col5 = ? order by col0;
8
execute 8 6 600 6000 6234.4321 62345678.99 str6;
|6|600|6000|6234.432100|62345678.99|str6|
1 rows returned

--close session;
-- ps should now be closed as session was closed;
execute 8 6 600 6000 6234.4321 62345678.99 str6;
cannot find prepared statement with id 8

drop source test_source_1;
Ok

--delete topic testtopic;
